questions.text: What did Sam accidentally call Karen in the cold opening?
questions.explanation:
Barbra.

	This was pure Sammy genius as he explained how Barbra meant Karen to him. She asked why and he said (in paraphrase) Barbra reminded him of Barbra Streisand and that reminded him of the song "People" which reminded him of the first female person Eve. And the most famous Eve is Christmas Eve. And on Christmas Eve one goes Christmas Carolin' (Carolyn) and then after "you Karen the gifts". The woman ended up apologizing to Sam.

Postman of the Year.

	Cliff took his job as postman very seriously so when he was voted Postman of the Year he couldn't wait to tell everyone. He now had to find a date for the Postman's Ball.

questions.text: Who did Cliff ask to the ball first?
questions.explanation:
Diane.

	Diane said she couldn't go with him to the dance. She had her cheese of the month club that same day.

questions.text: Who did Cliff ask to the ball secondly?
questions.explanation:
Carla.

	When Diane couldn't go he asked Carla. She of course, laughed in his face.

questions.text: How much did Carla charge Cliff for a hug?
questions.explanation:
$5.

	Carla hated Cliff and never made it a secret how she felt. However, he offered to buy her a bunch of things including a new VCR (remember this was the 80s a VCR was a big deal).

questions.text: Who did Cliff go to the ball with?
questions.explanation:
Diane.

	Diane after talking to Sam, decided that her cheese of the month club could meet without her this time so she could help out a friend. As a result Cliff had to get another date for Carla.

questions.text: What did Woody tell Diane she looked like?
questions.explanation:
a hundred bucks.

	Woody apparently didn't know the expression was "You look like a million bucks". That or being Woody he realized she didn't pay a million dollars for her clothes and therefore didn't look like a million bucks.

questions.text: What did Carla say she was going out with?
questions.correct: "The stick, the nerd, and door number three."
options: "The stick, the nerd, and door number three."
questions.explanation:
"The stick, the nerd, and door number three."

	Carla always called Diane "the stick" because she was so thin. Since Cliff always bored everyone with trivial facts, he was "the nerd". Her date, only mumbled so no one could understand him, ergo, he was "door number three".

questions.correct: Diane wished he'd come on stronger
options: he was a better date than her date
questions.explanation:
Diane wished he'd come on stronger.

	Diane never told Carla anything. However, Carla thought it would be funny if Cliff came on to Diane since Diane would likely get angry about it.

options: It's Not For Me to Say
questions.explanation:
Misty.

	All the song choices were songs sung by Johnny Mathis. Carla had told Cliff that Diane wanted him to sing "Misty" while rubbing his fingers up and down her arm Cliff was dumb enough to believe it so that's what he did. As a result, Diane kicked him out of the car and he had to walk home.
